resources.string: Welcome to SmartyPlants! The fun and educational way for kids to learn about common plants, and which to stay away from.
A usually climbing plant that has leaves with three leaflets and can cause an itchy painful rash when touched
Location: Eastern Africa and India. Found in suitable climates and can be an ivasive plant.
Location: North and South America. Part of the Spurge family.

When this oil touches your skin, it often causes an itchy, blistering rash. Make a paste of baking soda. This common household item will work to draw out the poisons in the skin and sooth the rash once it has already formed

its shiny black berries are perhaps a temptation to children, but fatal in even small doses. Found mainly on chalky and limestone soils, particularly on recently disturbed ground, this bushy perennial has bell-shaped flowers that appear from June to August.

All parts of Brugmansia (genus) are potentially poisonous, with the seeds and leaves being especially dangerous. Effects of ingestion can include paralysis of smooth muscles, confusion, tachycardia, dry mouth, diarrhea, migraine headaches, visual and auditory hallucinations, mydriasis, rapid onset cycloplegia, and death.

string-array.name: Questions
string-array.item: What is true about Poison ivy?
Dead Poison ivy is no longer toxic
How do you stop the spread of poison ivy?
wash off the surface with water or rubbing alcohol.
wash off the surface with water or rubbing alcohol.
How do you get a rash?
What is the rash causing agent called?
What is false about Poison Ivy?
It changes colors depending on the season
It can grow as a bush or vine
It sometimes has white berries on it
How long does a rash USUALLY last?
What part of Ricinus is poisonous?
Is it safe to set Cerbera on fire?

resources.string: Hyacinthus grows from bulbs, each producing around four to six linear leaves and one to three spikes or racemes of flowers.
The leaves are divided into three (rarely 5, 7, or 9) leaflets with scalloped, toothed, or lobed edges.
The flowers lack petals and have four (rarely five) petaloid sepals, tubular at the base with free lobes at the apex.
The flowers are generally white or yellow (also orange or pink in garden varieties), with either uniform or contrasting coloured tepals and corona.
The glossy leaves are 45cm in length with tooth segments. Its most poisonous part are its seeds known as Castor beans.
This tree is poisonous upon consumption, touch, or inhale.
Cerbera and its alternate leaves are all subject to poison. As well as lighting it on fire would create a poisionous smoke.
Also known as "Deadly Nightshade", it is one of the most poisonous plants in the world. Consuming can be fatal. Intense digestive disturbance and nervous symptoms.

Botanists will tell you that members of the genus Brugmansia get their nickname, "Angel's Trumpet," from their large, hanging, trumpet-shaped flowers, which can measure up to 50cm long and 35cm wide at their openings.
This quiz contains 10 randomly selected multiple choice questions based on the plants found in this app.
